quotes.quote: When people complain of your complexity, they fail to remember that they made fun of your simplicity.
Humans are naturally social; civilization causes us to be antisocial.
Self abuse is anti-social, aggression still natural.

The theoretically unrestricted right to develop power, to wage war against other states, is antisocial and is doubly dangerous, because the state as a mass entity represents a low moral and intellectual level.
To bring into the world an unwanted human being is as antisocial an act as murder.
Nobody enjoys the company of others as intensely as someone who usually avoids the company of others.
You might be an introvert if you were ready to go home before you left the house.
Anti-social behaviour still blights lives, wrecks communities and provides a pathway to criminality.
Anti-social behavior is a trait of intelligence in a world full of conformists.
Apparently when it's two people, it's quirky and funny, but when it's a person doing the same stuff on her own, it's rebellious and antisocial.
Nobody adopts antisocial behaviour unless they fear that they will fail if they remain on the social side of life.
Sometimes those who don't socialize much aren't actually anti-social, they just have no tolerance for drama and fake people.
The trouble with not being into social networking is that people think you're anti social when you're only anti-networking.

People with antisocial personality disorders aren't automatically bad, they simply approach the world with a more ruthless set of lenses. The lack of empathy or very weak empathy and the ability to read other people's weak spots can be a flammable combination when you get in the way of something they want. But they aren't a different species. They're a part of our spectrum.
Being anti-social can also mean that you're aware of how annoying it is to be social.
If you think about computer programming, it's as antisocial as it gets.
